predictions.summary: Methylprednisolone is a standard component of cancer chemotherapy regimens, particularly for hematological malignancies.

evidence.fda_status: FDA-approved as part of chemotherapy regimens for leukemia and lymphoma
evidence.clinical_use: Standard component of CHOP regimen for NHL; high-dose methylprednisolone (HDMP) used in CLL treatment
evidence.mechanism: Glucocorticoids have specific cytolytic effects on leukemic and lymphomatous tissue; also used for managing chemotherapy side effects
evidence.key_finding: High doses (1 g/m2 for 5-8 days) can induce remissions in fludarabine-refractory CLL

predictions.summary: Erlotinib (Tarceva) was FDA-approved in 2005 in combination with gemcitabine for locally advanced or metastatic pancreatic cancer.

evidence.fda_status: FDA-approved 2005 for first-line treatment of locally advanced/metastatic pancreatic cancer (with gemcitabine)
evidence.clinical_trials: PA.3 Phase III trial: HR 0.82, P=0.038 for OS; 23% vs 17% 1-year survival
evidence.limitations: Modest absolute benefit (6.24 vs 5.91 months median OS); subsequent LAP07 trial showed non-significant difference
evidence.current_guidelines: ASCO recommends as option for ECOG PS 2 patients with dose adjustments

predictions.summary: Prednisolone is FDA-approved and widely used in cancer chemotherapy regimens, especially for hematological malignancies.

evidence.fda_status: FDA-approved for ALL, AML, CLL, CML, Hodgkin lymphoma, NHL, mycosis fungoides
evidence.clinical_use: Standard component of CHOP chemotherapy for NHL; dosages of 100 mg/days 1-5 most common (67% of trials)
evidence.mechanism: Demonstrated anticancer effect with cytolytic activity against lymphoid cells
evidence.additional_uses: Brain tumor/metastases (antiswelling), supportive care for symptoms

predictions.summary: Tretinoin has off-label use for psoriasis with supporting clinical evidence, though tazarotene is the preferred topical retinoid.

evidence.fda_status: Off-label use; tazarotene is FDA-approved retinoid for psoriasis
evidence.clinical_evidence: Best results with 0.3% tretinoin + corticosteroid for steroid-resistant psoriasis; effective for nail psoriasis
evidence.mechanism: Antiproliferative, normalizes keratinocyte differentiation, anti-inflammatory; slows skin cell growth
evidence.limitations: Low-level evidence compared to tazarotene; needs large-scale RCTs

predictions.summary: Trametinib is FDA-approved for BRAF V600-mutant melanoma both as monotherapy and in combination with dabrafenib.

evidence.fda_status: FDA-approved May 2013 (monotherapy), January 2014 (combination with dabrafenib), April 2018 (adjuvant)
evidence.clinical_trials: COMBI-AD: 870 patients, Stage III melanoma; COMBI-d: 25.1 vs 18.7 months OS
evidence.mechanism: MEK1/2 inhibitor targeting MAPK pathway; ~50% of melanomas have BRAF V600E mutations
evidence.expanded_approval: June 2022: Tumor-agnostic approval for all BRAF V600E solid tumors

predictions.summary: Triamcinolone is FDA-approved for rheumatoid arthritis as intra-articular injection for symptomatic relief.

evidence.fda_status: FDA-approved (Kenalog-10, Aristospan, Aristocort) for RA as adjunctive short-term therapy
evidence.clinical_use: Intra-articular injection for acute episodes; 40-80 mg IM with 4-week intervals; 5-40 mg intra-articular
evidence.mechanism: Corticosteroid reducing inflammation in affected joints
evidence.limitations: Short-term relief (up to 8 weeks); multiple injections increase infection risk

predictions.summary: Lovastatin shows promise for multiple myeloma via mevalonate pathway inhibition with Phase I/II clinical trial data.

evidence.fda_status: Not FDA-approved for myeloma; FDA-approved for hypercholesterolemia
evidence.clinical_trials: Phase I trial (1992-1994): 88 patients, doses up to 45 mg/kg/day tolerated; TLD regimen (thalidomide+lovastatin+dexamethasone): 88% response rate vs 67.8% TD
evidence.mechanism: HMG-CoA reductase inhibitor; blocks mevalonate pathway causing apoptosis in subset of MM cells
evidence.key_finding: Synergistic effect with dexamethasone; ~50% of MM cell lines are statin-sensitive based on genetic markers
evidence.limitations: Only subset of tumors responsive; no predictive biomarkers established

predictions.summary: Mirtazapine can CAUSE hypertension (hypertensive urgency reported), not treat it. This is a contraindicated prediction.

evidence.fda_status: FDA-approved for depression only; hypertension listed as adverse effect
evidence.safety_concern: Case report of hypertensive urgency (215/145 mmHg) after single 7.5mg dose
evidence.mechanism: Alpha-2 receptor antagonist enhances norepinephrine release; can increase blood pressure
evidence.warning: Product labeling lists hypertension as frequent cardiovascular side effect; requires BP monitoring

predictions.recommendation: EXCLUDE - Drug causes the condition it's predicted to treat

predictions.summary: Preclinical evidence shows crizotinib may lower blood glucose through insulin-independent mechanisms, but no clinical trials for T2D.

evidence.fda_status: FDA-approved for ALK+ NSCLC only; no clinical trials for diabetes
evidence.preclinical: Rat study: 25% blood glucose reduction independent of insulin/glucagon; GLUT4 upregulation in diabetic hearts
evidence.mechanism: May affect glucose transport via GLUT4 and PPAR pathways
evidence.limitations: No human clinical evidence; related drug ceritinib causes hyperglycemia; cardiotoxic potential

predictions.summary: Quetiapine (Seroquel) is FDA-approved for schizophrenia since 1997 and is a first-line treatment.

evidence.clinical_trials: Multiple 6-week trials showing superiority over placebo at 300-750 mg/day in adults
evidence.mechanism: Atypical antipsychotic; antagonist at serotonin, dopamine, histamine, and adrenergic receptors
evidence.advantages: Fewer extrapyramidal side effects and lower hyperprolactinemia risk vs other antipsychotics

filter_recommendations.pattern: Antidepressants with alpha-2 antagonism for hypertension
filter_recommendations.reason: Alpha-2 antagonists enhance norepinephrine release, which increases blood pressure

notes: 5 of 10 predictions (50%) are already FDA-approved for the predicted indication
2 predictions have clinical trial evidence supporting the use
2 predictions have preclinical/research support but need clinical validation
1 prediction is a clear FALSE POSITIVE where the drug causes the condition
High gene overlap (84) correctly identified Trametinib-melanoma (FDA-approved)
Model successfully identified standard chemotherapy drugs (corticosteroids for cancer)
The corticosteroid predictions (methylprednisolone, prednisolone, triamcinolone) confirm model recognizes established treatments
